missionProperties.missionDescription: If playing a mini campaign, heroes must bring a Spectre ally that they have not brought to a mission during this mini campaign. ==== A recent ISB raid has captured supplies critical to the resistance on Ryloth, along with encrypted data detailing their operations across the planet. Hera Syndulla has dispatched one of her crew to help you reclaim the supplies and data before the Empire can use it against the Twi'lek rebels.
missionProperties.repositionOverride:
Figures not on the northernmost section: Move to the northernmost section. Avoid neutral mission tokens, if possible.
{-} Figures on the northernmost section: Block the way of any Rebel figures. Avoid neutral mission tokens, if possible.
missionProperties.additionalMissionInfo: If playing a mini campaign, heroes must bring a Spectre ally that they have not brought to a mission during this mini campaign.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You near the location of the Imperial shuttle hauling the stolen supplies. The shuttles engines flare in the distance. Your borrowed blurrgs are eager to run, but they'll have to outpace Imperial speeder bikes.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Walls touching the walls of adjacent tiles do not block line of sight, movement, adjacency, or counting spaces.
{-} While on an exterior space:
— Figures and abilities ignore all terrain.
— At the start of each Rebel figure's activation, it gains 3 movement points.
— Imperial figures can only voluntarily move North, Northwest, or Northeast.

eventActions.newInstructions: {-} SPEEDER BIKE: While on an exterior space, add +1 to all Move instructions. This figure can only voluntarily move North, Northwest, or Northeast and ignores all terrain.

eventActions.tbText: Rocks have fallen from the canyon walls, blocking the way. The blurrgs can easily go around them, but they're a real danger for anyone on a speeder bike.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Rocks have fallen into the canyon here, blocking the way.

{-} When an Imperial figure enters a space containing a neutral mission token, it suffers 2 {H}.

Rocks have fallen into the canyon here, blocking the way.

{-} When an Imperial figure enters a space containing a neutral mission token, it suffers 2 {H}.

eventActions.tbText: {-} When an Imperial figure enters a space containing a neutral mission token, it suffers 2 {H}.

You spurn your blurrgs on. You need to go fast if you want to reach the shuttle in time.

{-} At the start of each Status Phase, the southernmost section is removed and each figure on it is pushed to the northern section, suffering {H} and {B} as instructed. Then the next section is added. Reuse Endcaps (Core 18B, Lothal 12B) as necessary.
{-} The mission will progress when the Rebels reach the shuttle. 
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Walls touching the walls of adjacent tiles do not block line of sight, movement, adjacency, or counting spaces.
{-} While on an exterior space:
— Figures and abilities ignore all terrain.
— At the start of each Rebel figure's activation, it gains 3 movement points.
— Imperial figures can only voluntarily move North, Northwest, or Northeast.
{-} When an Imperial figure enters a space containing a neutral mission token, it suffers 2 {H}.
{-} At the start of each Status Phase, the southernmost section is removed and each figure on it is pushed to the northern section, suffering {H} and {B} as instructed. Then the next section is added. Reuse Endcaps (Core 18B, Lothal 12B) as necessary.
{-} The mission will progress when the Rebels reach the shuttle. 
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
The shuttle’s consoles spark as the engines fail. The Twi'lek resistance plans and armaments are safe!

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} If playing as a side mission, heroes receive 1 Spectre ally of their choice as an ally.

eventActions.mainText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Outgunned, you call for an extraction as the Imperial shuttle escapes. The Phantom is a welcome sight, though Ryloth will suffer for your failure.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.mainText: Are you playing this mission as part of the "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
A team of Twi'lek resistance fighters sweeps in to recover the supplies and plans as quickly as possible. By the time you hear the distant screams of TIEs, you are already on your way to the nearest rebel safehouse.

Neither you nor the Twi'lek rebels have the luxury of a proper celebration, but they welcome you warmly to their hideout before you rendezvous with the Ghost.

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} Rebel players choose 1 hero to receive the “Rough Rider” Reward card.

eventActions.mainText:
Please select the correct option below.

{-} Extended campaign: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with the Thrawn Villain Pack.
{-} Mini campaign: I'm playing the regular "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign without any packs.

events.eventText:
A group of Twi'lek rebels helps to cover your retreat as the Imperial shuttle makes for orbit. You fall back to a safe distance without incurring any more casualties, but empty-handed. The Twil'eks thank you for your assistance even as they begin preparing to evacuate.

You're late for your rendezvous. Hera is relieved when you turn up. “We've lost enough friends to know when to worry," she explains.

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.

eventActions.mainText:
Please select the correct option below.

{-} Extended campaign: I'm playing the extended mini campaign with the Thrawn Villain Pack.
{-} Mini campaign: I'm playing the regular "Tyrants of Lothal" mini campaign without any packs.

events.eventText:
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

Thrawn has been tracking you closely ever since you joined up with the Spectres. You are certain that you haven't given away the Spectres’ location, but it’s starting to become a real problem. One that needs solving if you want to stay ahead of Thrawn.

Your contact on Lothal, N-4M, has good news. “I have purchased certain Imperial clearance codes,” the droid says. “I believe it will give you access to one particular location: the secondary docking bay of the Star Destroyer Chimaera.” N-4M doesn't need to explain how you can use this information. Thrawn’s infiltrator droids are all controlled from his flagship. A surgical strike at its heart could give you just the breathing room you need.

{-} The next active mission is “The Admiral’s Grip” (Thrawn Villain Pack).

You hear the heated debate in the Ghost's common room well before you see it. "This could be our best chance to take the fight to Thrawn", insists Ezra, gesturing toward a holographic depiction of Lothal, complete with several Star Destroyers in orbit. "I know this might be a trap, but what if it isn't? We've been working hard to find an opening to strike back at Thrawn."

You interrupt to ask what's going on.

"An Imperial engineer got us a message", says Kanan. "He wants to defect, and he says he can get us into the datavault containing everything Thrawn's infiltrator droids have gathered." You have to simply imagine the significant look on Kanan's face as the mask tilts in your direction. "Information that gives him an edge on the Rebellion. But someone just letting us in? It sounds too good to be true."

"We'd never even get to the ground with Thrawn's goons everywhere", says Zeb. "Every Imperial in the sector probably knows what we look like."

You step forward. The Spectres are important to the Rebellion. They can't afford to take the chance. But you can.

{-} The next active mission is “The Final Order”.

The race continues as your blurrgs rush forward.

{-} Push each figure on the southernmost exterior space to the nearest space on the next section. Then, each Imperial figure that was pushed suffers 2 {H}, and each Rebel figure that was pushed suffers 4 {C}.

The race continues as your blurrgs rush forward.

{-} Push each figure on the southernmost exterior space to the nearest space on the next section. Then, each Imperial figure that was pushed suffers 2 {H}, and each Rebel figure that was pushed suffers 4 {C}.

The race continues as your blurrgs rush forward.

{-} Push each figure on the southernmost exterior space to the nearest space on the next section. Then, each Imperial figure that was pushed suffers 2 {H}, and each Rebel figure that was pushed suffers 4 {C}.

Your blurrgs growl and snarl as the shuttle finally comes into sight. With a mighty leap they rush forward towards the ship whose engines are already running, ready for take-off. You don't have much time.

{-} Push each figure on the southernmost exterior space to the nearest space on the next section. Then, each Imperial figure that was pushed suffers 2 {H}, and each Rebel figure that was pushed suffers 4 {C}.

eventActions.tbText:
Getting into the shuttle's landing bay will require a leap of faith with your blurrg, and there won't be a way back.

{-} Figures on the Shuttle cannot leave the Shuttle.
Through the open hatch you can see the engine control consoles.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The engine control console hums softly.

{-} A Rebel figure can attack the terminal (Health: *2*, Defense: 1 {G). Apply +1 {G} to the defense results if an Imperial figure is on or adjacent to the terminal.

The engine control console hums softly.

{-} A Rebel figure can attack the terminal (Health: *2*, Defense: 1 {G). Apply +1 {G} to the defense results if an Imperial figure is on or adjacent to the terminal.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} A Rebel figure can attack a terminal (Health: *2*, Defense: 1 {G). Apply +1 {G} to the defense results if an Imperial figure is on or adjacent to the terminal.
{-} The Rebels win when both terminals are destroyed.

eventActions.repositionText:
Figures not on the shuttle: Move to the shuttle. Avoid neutral mission tokens, if possible.
{-} Figures on the shuttle: Block access to the terminals.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Walls touching the walls of adjacent tiles do not block line of sight, movement, adjacency, or counting spaces.
{-} While on an exterior space:
— Figures and abilities ignore all terrain.
— At the start of each Rebel figure's activation, it gains 3 movement points.
— Imperial figures can only voluntarily move North, Northwest, or Northeast.
{-} When an Imperial figure enters a space containing a neutral mission token, it suffers 2 {H}.
{-} Figures on the Shuttle cannot leave the Shuttle.
{-} A Rebel figure can attack a terminal (Health: *2*, Defense: 1 {G). Apply +1 {G} to the defense results if an Imperial figure is on or adjacent to the terminal.
{-} The Rebels win when both terminals are destroyed.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText: More forces join the race toward the shuttle, trying to keep you from reaching it.
With a roar of repulsor engines, an airspeeder comes rushing through the canyon. On the gunner seat you see none other than Thrawn himself.

eventActions.tbText: With roaring engines, more speeder bikes move in.

events.eventText: "It is so nice to meet you again!", a boosted voice echoes through the canyons. Through a gap in the rocks, a speeder bike comes racing. Hondo Ohnaka, the rider, waves merrily at you, then draws his blaster. "And it is so sad that I need to stop you."

eventActions.tbText: With roaring engines, more speeder bikes move in.

events.eventText: Out of the cockpit, Thrawn's forces rush in to stop you.
Out of the cockpit, Hondo's goons rush in to stop you.
The engine control explodes in a shower of sparks.
